      public void start(StartablePluginCallbackHandler pluginCallbackHandler, boolean serverStarting)
      Description copied from interface: IStartablePlugin
      Called during server startup and from the UI. All callback operations should be wrapped by the execute() method of the given StartablePluginCallbackHandler.
      Specified by:
      start in interface IStartablePlugin
      Parameters:
      pluginCallbackHandler - Implementation of StartablePluginCallbackHandler that executes as the system user.
      serverStarting - true if the request comes from the fact that the server is starting; false if it comes from the UI

      public String getParameter(String paramName)
      Description copied from interface: AuthenticationVerifierPlugin

      Specified by:

    • verifyToken

      public AuthenticationResult verifyToken(AuthenticationToken token, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Description copied from interface: AuthenticationVerifierPlugin
      This method is responsible for verifying a particular AuthenticationToken and, if the token is indeed valid, for mapping that to an AuthenticationResult.
      Specified by:
      verifyToken in interface AuthenticationVerifierPlugin

    • verifyToken

      public AuthenticationResult verifyToken(AuthenticationToken authToken)
      Description copied from interface: AuthenticationVerifierPlugin
      This method is responsible for verifying a particular AuthenticationToken and, if the token is indeed valid, for mapping that to an AuthenticationResult.

      NOTE: The out of the box authentication implementation no longer supports this method. AuthenticationVerifierPlugin.verifyToken(AuthenticationToken, HttpServletRequest) should be used instead

      Specified by:
      verifyToken in interface AuthenticationVerifierPlugin

    • createAuthenticationResult

      protected AuthenticationResult createAuthenticationResult(JsonWebToken jwt, @Nullable JsonObject userContext)

    • getExplicitMatchers

      protected List<UserTypeMatcher> getExplicitMatchers()
      Return the list of applicable matchers that should be explicitly matched against the incoming JWT. Any matcher that is expected to directly create its AuthorizedUser without first matching the JWT should not be included in this list.

      Matchers in this list should be mutually exclusive; that is, for any given JWT, it should be impossible for more than one matcher to match it.

      Returns:
      list of matchers to explicitly match against the JWT

    • validate

      protected boolean validate(JsonObject tokenBody, @Nullable JsonObject userContext)

    • validateSignature

    • validateUserContext
